title: Introduction to Stirling PDF
description: Complete self-hosted PDF processing toolkit with advanced document management capabilities

slides.title: Stirling PDF Mastery
slides.subtitle:
Complete Self-Hosted PDF Processing
From Installation to Advanced Workflows

list.text: What is Stirling PDF? - Open Source PDF Toolkit

box.content: Self-hosted web application for PDF processing

note.text: Key advantage: Complete privacy - your documents never leave your infrastructure!

list.text: Privacy First - No cloud uploads, complete control
No Vendor Lock-in - You control your data

box.code:
# Basic Docker run command
docker run -d \
  --name stirling-pdf \
  -p 8080:8080 \
  -v /local/path:/tmp \
  frooodle/s stirling-pdf:latest

# With Docker Compose
version: '3.8'
services:
  stirling-pdf:
    image: frooodle/s stirling-pdf:latest
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - ./data:/tmp
    restart: unless-stopped

list.text: Extract Form Data - Get form field values
Custom Headers - Add text to top of pages
Dark Mode - Easy on eyes, reduced strain
REST API - Programmatic access to all features

box.code:
curl -X POST \
  http://localhost:8080/api/convert/image \
  -H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
  -F 'file=@/path/to/image.jpg' \
  -o converted.pdf

# Python example
import requests

response = requests.post(
    'http://localhost:8080/api/convert/image',
    files={'file': open('image.jpg', 'rb')}
)

with open('output.pdf', 'wb') as f:
    f.write(response.content)

list.text: Data Privacy - Files never leave your network

box.code:
# docker-compose.yml for production
version: '3.8'
services:
  stirling-pdf:
    image: frooodle/s stirling-pdf:latest
    container_name: stirling-pdf
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    environment:
      - DOCKER_ENABLE_SECURITY=false
      - STIRLING_WEB_ROOT=
    volumes:
      - ./data:/usr/share/tessdata
      - ./logs:/logs
    restart: unless-stopped
    networks:
      - proxy

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true

list.text: No Cloud Uploads - Files stay on your server

box.code:
1. Visit github.com/Stirling-Tools/Stirling-PDF
2. Check existing issues for duplicates
3. Create new issue with:
   - Clear description of the feature
   - Use cases and benefits
   - Any relevant examples
4. Follow the project's contribution guidelines
5. Engage with community discussions
6. Consider contributing code if possible

Essential Operations:
â€¢ Merge PDFs: Combine multiple documents
â€¢ Split PDF: Extract specific pages
â€¢ Compress: Reduce file size
â€¢ OCR: Make scanned docs searchable
â€¢ Convert: Images/Office docs to PDF

Security Tools:
â€¢ Add Password: Encrypt with password
â€¢ Remove Password: Decrypt files
â€¢ Digital Sign: Add electronic signatures
â€¢ Watermark: Brand or mark documents

Advanced Features:
â€¢ Batch Process: Multiple files at once
â€¢ API Access: Programmatic control
â€¢ Form Handling: Fill and flatten forms
â€¢ Metadata: Edit document properties

Deployment:
â€¢ Docker: docker run -p 8080:8080 frooodle/s stirling-pdf
â€¢ Default URL: http://localhost:8080
